title: Description of osi_phosphor
text: Phosphorus (P) essential nutrient crops applied agricultural soil bring keep soil certain target soil P status view optimal crop yield. P supply key aspect soil health. Phosphorus soil can present organic inorganic P, inorganic P typically contributing 35 70% total soil P. soils receiving long-term inputs P fertilizers animal manures, contribution inorganic P total soil P usually increases, inorganic P abundant animal manures. Inorganic P includes phosphate sorbed reactive soil particles (amorphous Fe- Al-(hydr)oxides oxidic clay mineral edges) phosphate-bearing minerals. normal pH range 5 8 agricultural soils, P sorption major mechanism controlling P concentration soil solution. extent soils can sorb P depends maximum P sorption capacity non-calcareous soils relates amorphous Fe- Al-(hydr)oxides contents. Assessments soil health view phosphorus usually follow agronomic Build-Maintenance approach, measured soil P contents used classify soil P status, used derive best P fertilizer strategy specific crop. approach, agricultural soils ultimately reach “target” soil P status optimal crop produciton. Currently, target soil P status determined economic optimization crop yield P fertilizer inputs equals crop P removal, although countries recommend adding additional P correct “inevitable” P losses caused progressive shift plant-available P less available soil P forms environmental P losses. target soil P status currently corresponds P status 90% relative crop yield achieved. target soil P status derived long-term P fertilization experiments. Routine agronomic soil P tests common make use extraction methods determine certain fraction total soil P correlated crop response. extracted amount P varies nature extraction solution methodological factors soil pretreatment, soil--solution ratio analytical technique used P measurement. measuring readily available P forms can taken crop short-term, soil P tests (referred P intensity methods) 0.01 M CaCl2 water extraction method can used. measurement labile moderately strong bound P (referred P quantity methods), extractions acid ammonium acetate-lactate (P-AL), Mehlich3 sodium bicarbonate (P-Olsen) can used. European Open Soil Index assesses soil function P supply using agronomic knowledge base used various EU countries. soil P supply transformed unitless indicator score ranging zero (poor quality) one (optimum quality). indicator score reflects ‘distance target’ (.e. difference current optimum situation, ensuring soil functions limiting). deviates score 1, poorer soil function works. indicator value 0.5 approximately corresponds threshold level fertilization guidelines (additional) fertilization recommended (given ‘buildup maintenance’ approach implemented fertilizer recommendation systems). Overall, indicator value can interpreted good (>0.75), sufficient (0.5-0.75), poor (<0.5).

title: Description of osi_phosphor
text: euso package wrapper function assess soil health index soil P supply agricultural soils across Europe. wrapper function osi_c_phosphor following inputs: B_LU (character) crop code B_SOILTYPE_AGR (character) soil type particular region A_CLAY_MI (numeric) clay content soil (%) A_SAND_MI (numeric) sand content soil (%) A_SOM_LOI (numeric) organic matter content soil (%) A_C_OF (numeric) organic carbon content soil (g C / kg) A_PH_WA (numeric) pH measured water. A_PH_CC (numeric) pH measured CaCl2 extraction. A_CACO3_IF (numeric) percentage CaCO3 (%) A_P_AAA (numeric) exchangeable P-content soil measured via acid ammonium acetate extraction (mg P / kg) A_P_AL (numeric) P-content soil extracted ammonium lactate (mg P / kg) A_P_CAL (numeric) exchangeable P-content soil measured via Calcium Ammonium Lactate (mg P/ kg) A_P_CC (numeric) P-content soil extracted CaCl2 (mg P / kg) A_P_DL (numeric) P-content soil extracted double lactate (mg P / kg) A_P_M3 (numeric) exchangeable P-content soil measured via Mehlich 3 extracton (mg P/ kg) A_P_OL (numeric) P-content soil extracted Olsen (mg P / kg) A_P_WA (numeric) P-content soil extracted water (mg P / kg) B_COUNTRY (character) country code inputs mandatory. function runs soil parameters available LUCAS. soil P extraction methods can added, unknown, estimated P-Olsen using published pedotransferfunctions, using function osi_conv_phosphor. Similarly, helper functions applied estimate A_C_OF, A_PH_KCL A_PH_WA. wrapper function wraps country specific P assessment functions. illustrated described vignette per country, sorted alphabetically.

title: Description of osi_potassium
text: Principle: exchangeable potassium evaluated based (1) crop needs (high need, moderate need, low need) mentioned osi_crops table (2) region (3) soil type Two thresholds exist (1) Timp = soil supplies crop need, concentration fertilizer response (2) Trenf = threshold, soil needs replenished, fertilizer recommendation > supply logistic function based exchangeable K comparison export plant: score 0 supply = 0; score 1 supply = export. growth rate offset based threshold values, growth rate near maximum set 1. See page 25 reference. !!! Threshold values given mg/kg K2O5, conversion done =(Treshold/(158 1936^3))x2x39.0983*10^3 Reference: Comifer, 2019, La fertilisation P-K-Mg; Les bases due raisonnement

title: Description of osi_zinc
text: Principle: mais lin, threshold values exist based Zn EDTA (mg/kg) dependent pH: pH < 6.2: 1 mg/kg, pH> 6.2: 2 mg/kg Source: https://www.arvalis.fr/infos-techniques/carences-en-oligo-elements-reperer-les-situations-risque-grace-lanalyse-de-terre

what: Calculate the Open Soil Index Score for Europe
title: Calculate the Open Soil Index Score for Europe
text: Open Soil Index (OSI) method evaluate quality soils agricultural fields sustainability current agricultural practices. OSI score based four main criteria: chemical, physical, biological management. package European implementation Dutch Open Bodem Index Calculator (OBIC). providing results soil analysis management info ‘euosi’ package can use calculate scores, indicators derivatives used evaluate soil quality. current R package still development. want contribute, please contact main developers Gerard Ros Elise van Eynde. information Open soil Index can found https://pubs.acs.org/doi/10.1021/acs.est.2c04516#.

(default = )

title: Calculate indicators for water holding capacity in the topsoil — osi_p_whc
text: function returns default water holding capacity ('whc') top soil (mm). numeric value. outputs include 'plant available water' ('paw') 'ksat' saturated permeability. Soil functions evaluated given threshold value expressed distance target.

title: Calculate indicators for water holding capacity in the topsoil — osi_p_whc
text: Wosten et al. (2001) Pedotransfer functions: bridging gap available basic soil data missing hydraulic characteristics. Journal Hydrology 251, p123.

title: Calculate indicators for water holding capacity in the topsoil — osi_p_whc
code: osi_p_whc(A_CLAY_MI = 20.5,A_SAND_MI = 65,A_SOM_LOI = 3.5) #> [1] 0.8273837 osi_p_whc(A_CLAY_MI = 5,A_SAND_MI = 15,A_SOM_LOI = 6.5) #> [1] 0.8251179 osi_p_whc(A_CLAY_MI = 5,A_SAND_MI = 15,A_SOM_LOI = 6.5,  type = 'water holding capacity') #> [1] 0.8251179
